intro: Echium pumilum, commonly known as the dwarf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a low-growing annual herb with narrow, grass-like leaves and produces striking violet or purple flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which is characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by moths and other nocturnal insects. Echium pumilum is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
